abstract.para: The topic covers the preparation of zFCD disks for the deployment.

topic.para: To prepare the machine to deploy on zFCP/SCSI discs, proceed as described below:

step.para: Find all disks by running the command:
step.screen:
&prompt.root;lszdev zfcp
TYPE ID ON PERS NAMES zfcp-host 0.0.fa00 yes yes zfcp-host 0.0.fc00 yes yes zfcp-lun 0.0.fa00:0x500507630b181216:0x4021400a00000000 yes no sda sg0 zfcp-lun 0.0.fc00:0x500507630b101216:0x4021400b00000000 yes no sdb sg1

step.para: In the output there should be a LUN device—a device of the type zfcp-lun. If the command does not output any device, enable the disk first:
If you do not know the disk name, contact your system administrator.
Verify that the LUN device exists:
step.screen:
&prompt.root;lszdev zfcp
TYPE ID ON PERS NAMES zfcp-host 0.0.fa00 yes yes zfcp-host 0.0.fc00 yes yes zfcp-lun 0.0.fa00:0x500507630b181216:0x4021400a00000000 yes no sda sg0 zfcp-lun 0.0.fc00:0x500507630b101216:0x4021400b00000000 yes no sdb sg1

step.para: Note the information about LUN devices. The /dev/sda device is used further for the deployment of &productname;.

Even though formatting of the disk, where &productname; will be deployed, is not necessary. Check if the disk is empty and does not contain any partition. If there are any partitions, remove them with the following command. Beware, the command will erase data on the provided device!
